data.meta_description: Lin Huiyin (known as Phyllis Lin or Lin Whei-yin when in the United States; 10 June 1904 â€“ 1 April 1955) was a Chinese architect and architectural historian. She is known to be the first female architect in modern China and her husband the famed "Father of Modern Chinese Architecture" Liang Sicheng, both of whom worked as founders and faculty in the newly formed Architecture Department of Northeastern University in 1928 and, after 1949, as professors in Tsinghua University in Beijing.
